intro: Gardoquia rugosa, commonly known as the rough gardoquia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are deeply lobed and have a distinctive, rough texture that gives it its common name. Gardoquia rugosa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid climates.
